title: Applying Self-Regulated Learning Theory in [Large-Scale] Environmental Education: Practical Strategies for Pre-Service Teachers

context.prior_knowledge: Fundamental concepts of environmental education and basic understanding of self-regulation theory
context.additional_context: A course focused on enhancing preservice/in-service teachers' competencies in designing and implementing environmental education lessons

learning_goals: Learners can apply Self-Determination Theory (SDT) core principles (autonomy, competence, relatedness) to environmental education activities
Learners can analyze systemic characteristics of environmental issues and propose practical solutions through group brainstorming and discussion
Learners can evaluate and improve the sustainability of environmental protection behaviors through self-regulated reflection

resources: Digital Collaboration Tools (e.g., Padlet, Google Jamboard)

difficulty: Easy - Simple structure with minimal constraints
